Local representative assistance upon arrival and during tours.
exclusions: Airfare to and from Srinagar.
Gondola ride tickets in Gulmarg (Phase 1 & 2).
Pony rides or local transport in Gulmarg (e.g., to snow point) and Pahalgam (e.g., Baisaran, Aru, Chandanwari).
Entrance fees to any gardens, monuments, or other attractions unless specifically mentioned.
Optional day trip to Sonmarg (transfers and activities).
Meals not specified in the itinerary (lunch, dinner, except where mentioned).
Personal expenses such as laundry, telephone calls, tips for drivers/guides, etc.
Travel insurance.

title: Kashmir Expedition
description: Embark on an extensive 7-day 'Kashmir Expedition', a comprehensive tour designed to unveil the complete charm of India's most stunning region. From the serene waters of Dal Lake to the snow-capped peaks of Gulmarg and Sonmarg, and the verdant valleys of Pahalgam, this package offers a deeper dive into Kashmir's breathtaking landscapes, rich Mughal heritage, and vibrant local culture. Experience comfortable stays, scenic drives, and unforgettable moments in 'Paradise on Earth'.
highlights: Experience the unique charm of staying in a traditional Kashmiri houseboat on Dal Lake, including a relaxing Shikara ride.
Explore the exquisite Mughal Gardens of Srinagar and enjoy panoramic views from Shankaracharya Temple.
Visit Gulmarg, the 'Meadow of Flowers', and enjoy the thrilling Gondola Cable Car Ride.
Journey to Pahalgam, the 'Valley of Shepherds', with stops at saffron fields and ancient ruins.
Enjoy leisure time and optional activities in Pahalgam, including pony rides to scenic valleys like Baisaran, Aru, and Betaab Valley.
Discover the majestic beauty of Sonmarg, the 'Meadow of Gold', with views of the Thajiwas Glacier.

itinerary.title: Arrival – Srinagar Houseboat Experience
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Srinagar Airport (SXR), you will be warmly met and greeted by our CircleTrip representative. Enjoy a comfortable transfer to your traditional houseboat on Dal Lake, a unique and iconic Kashmiri experience. Upon arrival, enjoy a welcome drink and take some time to relax. In the late afternoon, embark on a serene and relaxing Shikara ride on Dal Lake, gliding past floating gardens, local life, and enjoying breathtaking sunset views over the tranquil waters. Overnight stay on a luxurious Houseboat in Srinagar.

itinerary.title: Srinagar Local Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After breakfast on board your houseboat, embark on a full-day guided tour of Srinagar. Visit the renowned Mughal Gardens: Nishat Bagh (Garden of Pleasure), Shalimar Bagh (Abode of Love), and Chashme Shahi (Royal Spring), known for their terraced lawns, cascading fountains, and vibrant flowerbeds. Afterward, ascend to the Shankaracharya Temple, perched on a hilltop, offering panoramic views of Srinagar city and Dal Lake. In the afternoon, explore local craft shops, famous for exquisite Pashmina shawls, intricate Paper Mache artistry, and traditional Kashmiri wooden crafts. Overnight stay in a comfortable Hotel in Srinagar.

itinerary.title: Gulmarg Excursion
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, embark on a scenic drive to Gulmarg, the 'Meadow of Flowers' (approx. 2 hours drive). Gulmarg is a popular destination for its stunning natural beauty and is renowned as one of the best skiing resorts in India during winter. Upon arrival, you can experience the thrilling Gulmarg Gondola Cable Car Ride, one of the highest in the world, taking you to Kongdoori (Phase 1) and Apharwat Peak (Phase 2), offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Pir Panjal mountain range (Gondola tickets on direct payment). Visit the charming St. Mary’s Church and the world's highest green golf course, Gulmarg Golf Course. During winter, enjoy various snow sports and activities. Return to Srinagar by evening. Overnight stay in Srinagar.

itinerary.title: Srinagar to Pahalgam
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Srinagar hotel, begin a picturesque drive to Pahalgam, famously known as the 'Valley of Shepherds' (approx. 2.5-3 hours drive). En route, you will pass through the fragrant Pampore saffron fields (seasonal) and visit the ancient ruins of Avantipura Temple, an archaeological site. Upon arrival in Pahalgam, check-in to your hotel. In the afternoon, enjoy some leisure time by the serene Lidder River, or simply relax amidst the breathtaking natural beauty of the valley. Overnight accommodation in Pahalgam.

itinerary.title: Pahalgam Activities
itinerary.description: After breakfast, enjoy a full day to explore the enchanting landscapes of Pahalgam. This day is flexible for you to choose your activities (optional activities like pony rides or local vehicle hire are on direct payment). You can take a scenic pony ride to Baisaran Valley, often referred to as 'Mini Switzerland' due to its lush meadows and dense pine forests. Alternatively, explore the beautiful Aru Valley, Chandanwari (the starting point for Amarnath Yatra), and Betaab Valley (named after a Bollywood movie). You can also relax at local cafes, enjoy trout fishing (seasonal, permits required), or simply take leisurely walks along the riverbanks. Overnight accommodation in Pahalgam.

itinerary.title: Sonmarg Day Tour & Return to Srinagar
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Pahalgam hotel, embark on a full-day excursion to Sonmarg, the 'Meadow of Gold' (approx. 3-4 hours drive from Pahalgam). Sonmarg is a spectacular valley adorned with majestic glaciers and pristine lakes. Upon arrival, you have the option to take a thrilling pony ride or hire a local vehicle (on direct payment) to visit the magnificent Thajiwas Glacier, offering stunning views of snow-capped mountains and cascading waterfalls. Spend time soaking in the natural splendor. In the late afternoon, drive back to Srinagar. Check-in to your hotel in Srinagar. Overnight stay in Srinagar.

itinerary.title: Departure from Srinagar
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Srinagar Airport (SXR) for your return flight. Depart with unforgettable views and cherished memories of your grand 'Kashmir Expedition'. Package starting from 30,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 1 Night accommodation in a traditional Houseboat in Srinagar.
3 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Srinagar.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Pahalgam.
Daily breakfast at the hotels/houseboat.
1 Dinner on the houseboat (Day 1).
All transfers and sightseeing by private car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).
One Shikara ride on Dal Lake (01 hour) on Day 1.
Guided local sightseeing in Srinagar including Mughal Gardens (Nishat Bagh, Shalimar Bagh, Chashme Shahi) and Shankaracharya Temple. Entrance fees to Mughal Gardens included.
Full-day excursion to Gulmarg. Vehicle transfers included.
Full-day scenic drive to Pahalgam with en-route visits to Pampore saffron fields (seasonal) and Avantipura Ruins.
Full-day excursion to Sonmarg. Vehicle transfers included.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
Local representative assistance upon arrival and during tours.
exclusions: Airfare to and from Srinagar.
Gondola ride tickets in Gulmarg (Phase 1 & 2).
Pony rides or local transport in Gulmarg (e.g., to snow point) and Pahalgam (e.g., Baisaran, Aru, Chandanwari, Betaab Valley).

Travel insurance.

title: Dreamy Ladakh Adventure
description: Embark on a 'Dreamy Ladakh Adventure', an exhilarating 8-day journey through the breathtaking landscapes and unique culture of Ladakh. This package is designed to provide a comprehensive experience, covering the iconic Leh, serene Sham Valley, the mesmerizing Nubra Valley with its remote village of Turtuk, and the stunning Pangong Lake. Traverse high mountain passes, explore ancient monasteries, and immerse yourself in the unparalleled beauty of the 'Land of High Passes'.
highlights: Experience crucial acclimatization in Leh to enjoy the high altitude comfortably.
Explore Leh's cultural gems including Shanti Stupa, Thiksey Monastery, Magnetic Hill, Gurudwara Pathar Sahib, and the Indus-Zanskar confluence at Sangam.
Conquer Khardung La Pass, one of the highest motorable roads in the world, en route to Nubra Valley.
Enjoy the unique double-hump Bactrian camel ride amidst the sand dunes of Hunder in Nubra Valley.
Discover Turtuk, a captivating village near the Indo-Pak border, offering a glimpse into Baltistan culture.
Witness the mesmerizing beauty of Pangong Tso Lake, with its changing hues and serene surroundings.
Traverse Chang La Pass, another high mountain pass, offering stunning views.
Enjoy a buffer day in Leh for local exploration, souvenir shopping, or optional adventure activities.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Leh – Acclimatization Day
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Leh Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport (IXL), you will be warmly met by our local representative and transferred to your comfortable hotel in Leh. This day is crucial for acclimatization to the high altitude of Ladakh. It is highly recommended to rest completely and avoid any strenuous activities. In the evening, after a good rest, you can do a light bike check and test ride in the local area (if opting for bike tour). Overnight stay in Leh.

itinerary.title: Leh Local Exploration Ride
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a local sightseeing tour around Leh. Visit the iconic Shanti Stupa for panoramic views of Leh town, and the majestic Thiksey Monastery, known for its impressive Buddha statue and traditional Tibetan architecture. Continue your ride/drive to the mystical Magnetic Hill, where vehicles appear to defy gravity, and the serene Gurudwara Pathar Sahib. Conclude your day with a visit to Sangam Point, the picturesque confluence of the Indus and Zanskar rivers. Return to Leh for overnight stay. Overnight stay in Leh.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley via Khardung La (130 km / 5 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, prepare for an exciting journey as you head towards Nubra Valley. Your route takes you over the legendary Khardung La Pass (18,380 ft / 5,359 meters), considered one of the highest motorable roads in the world, offering breathtaking views of the Karakoram range. Upon descending into Nubra Valley, visit Diskit Monastery, the oldest and largest monastery in Nubra, with its impressive 106-foot-tall Buddha statue. Later, explore the unique Hunder Sand Dunes, where you can enjoy a memorable double-hump Bactrian camel ride (optional, direct payment). Overnight stay in a comfortable camp or hotel in Hunder / Nubra Valley.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Turtuk (85 km / 3 hrs, one way) – Last Village of India
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a fascinating ride/drive further north to the remote and picturesque village of Turtuk. Located very close to the Indo-Pak border, Turtuk is known for its unique Baltistan culture, apricot orchards, and stunning views of the Shyok River. Explore the village, interact with the friendly locals, and learn about their distinct way of life. Spend quality time soaking in the tranquility and beauty of this 'Last Village of India'. Return to Hunder by evening. Overnight stay in Nubra Valley.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Pangong Lake via Shyok (180 km / 6-7 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a truly spectacular journey to Pangong Tso Lake. The route often takes you along the scenic Shyok River, offering dramatic landscapes. Arrive at the mesmerizing Pangong Tso Lake (14,000 ft / 4,225 meters), famous for its ever-changing hues of blue. Spend the evening by the lakeside, enjoying the serene atmosphere and capturing unforgettable photographs. Overnight stay in a comfortable lakeside camp at Pangong.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Leh via Chang La (160 km / 6 hrs)
itinerary.description: Wake up to the stunning views of Pangong Lake. After breakfast, begin your return journey to Leh. Your route will take you over the picturesque Chang La Pass (17,586 ft / 5,360 meters), another high mountain pass offering incredible vistas. Make a stop at Tangtse for lunch and refreshments. Continue your descent, enjoying the diverse landscapes, until you reach Leh by evening. Overnight stay in Leh.

itinerary.title: Buffer/Leisure Day in Leh
itinerary.description: This day is dedicated as a buffer or leisure day, allowing you flexibility. You can explore the charming Leh market, shop for local souvenirs like Pashmina, traditional Ladakhi handicrafts, and Tibetan artifacts. Alternatively, you can opt for adventure activities such as river rafting in the Indus or Zanskar rivers (optional, direct payment), or simply relax and enjoy the vibrant cafe culture of Leh. If you are on a bike tour, this is a good day for a final bike check and prep for handover. Overnight stay in Leh.

itinerary.title: Departure from Leh
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Leh Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport (IXL) for your departure. Depart with high-altitude memories and the incredible experiences of your 'Dreamy Ladakh Adventure'. Package starting from 28,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 4 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Leh.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable camp/hotel in Nubra Valley (Hunder).
1 Night accommodation in a comfortable lakeside camp at Pangong Lake.
Daily breakfast at the hotels/camps.
2 Dinners at Nubra Valley and Pangong Lake camps.
All transfers and sightseeing by private SUV/Tempo Traveller (depending on group size) as per the itinerary.
Inner Line Permits for Nubra Valley, Pangong Lake, and Turtuk.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
Experienced local driver.
exclusions: Airfare to and from Leh.
Lunch and dinner in Leh (except where specified).

Personal expenses such as laundry, telephone calls, tips for drivers/guides, etc.
Travel insurance.
Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, landslides, natural calamities, etc.

title: Spiti Spin: Himalayan Odyssey
description: Embark on the 'Spiti Spin: Himalayan Odyssey', an exhilarating 9-day motorcycle or jeep expedition through the remote and awe-inspiring landscapes of the Spiti Valley in Himachal Pradesh. This journey takes you from the charming hills of Shimla, through the ancient monasteries and challenging terrains of Kinnaur and Spiti, to the breathtaking beauty of Chandratal Lake, culminating in the popular town of Manali. Discover a world of barren mountains, pristine rivers, vibrant Buddhist culture, and thrilling high-altitude passes on this unforgettable adventure.
highlights: Experience scenic rides through the picturesque hills of Himachal Pradesh, starting from Shimla.
Witness the majestic Kinnaur Kailash range from Kalpa, a truly spiritual sight.
Explore ancient monasteries like Tabo and Key, offering insights into Tibetan Buddhist culture.
Visit the world's highest post office in Hikkim and one of the highest villages, Komic.
Conquer high mountain passes including Kunzum Pass and Rohtang Pass (subject to opening), offering thrilling challenges and panoramic views.
Spend a night under the stars by the enchanting Chandratal Lake, the 'Moon Lake'.
Traverse diverse terrains, from lush valleys to barren high-altitude deserts and challenging off-road stretches.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Shimla – Bike Check & Ride to Narkanda (65 km)
itinerary.description: Arrive in Shimla, the picturesque capital of Himachal Pradesh. Upon arrival, meet our representative and proceed to collect your allocated motorcycle (if opting for a bike tour). After a brief introduction and safety briefing, embark on your first ride towards Narkanda (approx. 65 km), a charming hill station known for its apple orchards and panoramic views. Settle into your accommodation and enjoy the serene surroundings. Overnight stay in Narkanda.

itinerary.title: Narkanda to Kalpa (160 km / 6 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, begin your scenic ride from Narkanda. The journey today takes you through beautiful landscapes, passing through towns like Rampur and Reckong Peo, before ascending to Kalpa. Kalpa offers breathtaking views of the majestic Kinnaur Kailash range, a sacred abode for Hindus and Buddhists. Spend the evening relaxing and soaking in the stunning vistas. Overnight stay in Kalpa.

itinerary.title: Kalpa to Nako to Tabo (190 km / 8 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, continue your 'Spiti Spin' adventure. Today's ride takes you alongside the powerful Sutlej River and into the captivating Spiti Valley. En route, visit Nako Lake, a serene high-altitude lake, and the unique Giu Mummy Village, famous for its naturally preserved mummy. Finally, reach Tabo, home to the ancient Tabo Monastery, a UNESCO World Heritage Site over 1000 years old, often called the 'Ajanta of the Himalayas'. Explore the monastery's intricate murals and stucco sculptures. Overnight stay in Tabo.

itinerary.title: Tabo to Kaza (60 km / 3 hrs) with Dhankar Detour
itinerary.description: After breakfast, depart from Tabo. Your first stop is a detour to the impressive Dhankar Monastery, precariously perched on a cliff overlooking the Spiti and Pin Rivers. After exploring Dhankar, continue your ride to Kaza, the administrative headquarters and cultural heart of Spiti Valley. Upon arrival, check-in to your accommodation. In the evening, you are free to explore Kaza's local cafes, visit the bustling market, and immerse yourself in the local Spitian culture. Overnight stay in Kaza.

itinerary.title: Key – Kibber – Hikkim – Komic Loop
itinerary.description: Today is dedicated to exploring the iconic villages and monasteries around Kaza. After breakfast, embark on a loop tour starting with a visit to Key Monastery, the largest and most famous monastery in Spiti, offering stunning views of the valley. Continue to Kibber Village, one of the highest inhabited villages in the world. Ascend further to Hikkim, home to the world’s highest post office, and Komic, one of the highest motorable villages in the world, boasting a monastery with incredible views. Return to Kaza by evening. Overnight stay in Kaza.

itinerary.title: Kaza to Chandratal Lake (100 km / 6 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, prepare for one of the most scenic and challenging rides of your journey. You will cross the magnificent Kunzum Pass (15,000 ft / 4,551 meters), the gateway to Lahaul Valley. From there, embark on an exhilarating off-road ride towards the enchanting Chandratal Lake (the 'Moon Lake'). Upon arrival at the designated camping site (vehicles cannot go right up to the lake), trek a short distance to the pristine lake. Spend the evening marveling at the lake's beauty, enjoying stargazing, and potentially a campfire (weather permitting). Overnight stay in comfortable dome tents near Chandratal Lake.

itinerary.title: Chandratal to Manali via Rohtang (130 km / 6 hrs)
itinerary.description: Wake up to the serene beauty of Chandratal Lake. After an early breakfast, begin your journey towards Manali. This leg of the trip involves a challenging but incredibly scenic off-road stretch from Batal, featuring numerous water crossings. You will then cross the famous Rohtang Pass (13,051 ft / 3,978 meters) (subject to opening dates), which connects Lahaul and Spiti valleys to Kullu Valley. Descend into the lush green landscapes of Manali by evening. Check-in to your hotel. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Buffer / Leisure Day in Manali
itinerary.description: Today is a buffer or leisure day in Manali, allowing you to relax or explore at your own pace. You can rest your muscles after the long ride, or opt for some local sightseeing, visiting places like Old Manali, the tranquil Hidimba Devi Temple, or enjoying the vibrant cafe scene. This day is also designated for returning your bikes (if applicable) and settling any formalities. In the evening, enjoy a celebratory dinner marking the end of your incredible Spiti adventure. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Departure from Manali
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your hotel, you will be transferred to Manali Bus Stand for your onward journey by Volvo or arranged for your flight departure from Kullu-Manali Airport (KUU). Depart with unforgettable Himalayan adventures and memories of your 'Spiti Spin'. Package starting from 28,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 8 Nights accommodation as per itinerary: 1 night in Narkanda, 1 night in Kalpa, 1 night in Tabo, 2 nights in Kaza, 1 night in Chandratal (dome tents), 2 nights in Manali.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the accommodations (starting from Dinner on Day 1, ending with Breakfast on Day 9).

Support vehicle (SUV/Tempo Traveller) for luggage and emergency backup (for group tours; for bike tours, luggage will be carried in the support vehicle).

Inner Line Permits and all necessary permits for Spiti Valley.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
Mechanic with basic spares (for bike tours, subject to group size).
exclusions: Airfare/train fare/bus fare to Shimla and from Manali.
Motorcycle rental (if applicable, typically extra charge for self-ride tours). Fuel for bikes (if applicable).
Lunch throughout the trip.
Optional activities not mentioned in inclusions (e.g., local sightseeing in Manali on leisure day, rafting, etc.).

Medical expenses and travel insurance.
Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, landslides, natural calamities, etc.
Any kind of personal riding gear for bike tours.

title: Majestic Manali: Valleys & Vistas
description: Embark on 'Majestic Manali: Valleys & Vistas', a captivating 5-day journey designed to immerse you in the enchanting beauty of Manali and its surrounding areas. This package offers a perfect blend of serene natural landscapes, adventure activities, and cultural exploration. From the bustling Mall Road to the thrilling Solang Valley, the engineering marvel of Atal Tunnel, and the spiritual hot springs of Manikaran, discover the diverse charm of this Himalayan paradise.
highlights: Experience the serene charm of Manali and explore its vibrant Mall Road and local Tibetan Monastery.
Enjoy thrilling adventure activities like paragliding and snow tubing in Solang Valley.
Drive through the impressive Atal Tunnel, an engineering marvel, and potentially visit Sissu.
Discover the cultural richness of Manali with visits to Hadimba Temple, Vashisht Kund, and Club House.
Indulge in café hopping and leisurely riverside walks amidst picturesque surroundings.
Embark on a scenic day trip to the bohemian village of Kasol and the spiritual site of Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Manali – Leisure Evening
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival in Manali (by overnight Volvo bus or private car transfer), you will be met by our representative and transferred to your pre-booked hotel. Check-in and enjoy welcome refreshments. Take some time to relax and settle in. In the evening, you are free to explore the bustling Mall Road, Manali's central hub for shopping and dining, and visit the peaceful Tibetan Monastery. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Solang Valley & Atal Tunnel Adventure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, embark on an exciting full-day excursion to Solang Valley, a popular hub for adventure sports. Here, you can indulge in various optional activities like paragliding, snow tubing, ziplining, or zorbing (on direct payment basis). Enjoy the stunning views of the surrounding mountains. Later, drive through the impressive Atal Tunnel, a marvel of engineering, and proceed towards Sissu (subject to road conditions and tunnel access), offering beautiful views of the Chandra River. Return to Manali by evening. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Local Sightseeing in Manali
itinerary.description: After breakfast, delve into the local attractions of Manali. Visit the ancient and unique Hadimba Devi Temple, a wooden temple set amidst cedar forests. Explore the charming Vashisht Village, known for its hot water springs and ancient temples. Continue to the Club House, a popular spot offering various recreational activities. You can also enjoy leisurely café hopping in Old Manali or serene riverside walks along the Beas River. The evening is free for personal leisure and shopping for local handicrafts and souvenirs. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Day trip to Kasol & Manikaran
itinerary.description: After an early breakfast, embark on a full-day scenic drive to the picturesque Parvati Valley. Your first stop is Kasol, a popular bohemian village known for its tranquil riverside cafes and vibrant atmosphere. Explore the village and soak in its unique charm. Afterward, proceed to Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara, a revered pilgrimage site for Sikhs and Hindus, famous for its natural hot springs believed to have medicinal properties. You can also visit the Shiva Temple nearby. Enjoy the serene spiritual ambiance. Return to Manali by evening. Overnight stay in Manali.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Manali Bus Stand for your onward journey by Volvo or to Kullu-Manali Airport (KUU) for your flight, carrying majestic memories of your Manali adventure. Package starting from 18,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 4 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Manali.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 5).
All transfers and sightseeing by private car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).

Full-day excursion to Kasol & Manikaran Sahib.

exclusions: Airfare/train fare/bus fare to and from Manali.

relatedPackages.title: Chai & Chill in the Hills: Dharamshala & McLeodganj

title: Serene Shimla: Hill Station Charm
description: Embark on 'Serene Shimla: Hill Station Charm', a delightful 4-day journey designed to immerse you in the captivating beauty and colonial allure of Shimla, the 'Queen of Hills'. This package offers a perfect blend of leisurely exploration, soft adventure, and scenic beauty, covering Shimla's iconic landmarks, the snowy landscapes of Kufri, and the peaceful retreats of Mashobra and Naldehra. Experience the enchanting atmosphere of this historic hill station, making for a perfect short getaway.
highlights: Experience a picturesque drive from Chandigarh to the charming hill station of Shimla.
Explore Shimla's colonial architectural marvels like The Ridge, Christ Church, and Scandal Point.
Enjoy leisure time and shopping along the famous Mall Road.
Discover the snowy landscapes and adventure activities at Kufri, including Kufri Fun World.
Visit the serene Himalayan Nature Park for wildlife encounters.
Indulge in peaceful nature walks in Mashobra and enjoy the lush greenery of Naldehra Golf Course.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Shimla – Local Exploration
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival in Chandigarh, you will be met by our representative and begin your scenic drive to Shimla (approx. 4-5 hours), the former summer capital of British India. Upon arrival, check-in at your comfortable hotel and take some time to rest and refresh. In the afternoon, embark on a leisurely walk to explore Shimla's prominent landmarks. Visit The Ridge, a large open space in the heart of Shimla, offering panoramic views of the surrounding hills. Admire the stunning Christ Church, one of the oldest churches in North India, and Scandal Point. Enjoy some leisurely shopping at Mall Road, the main street of Shimla, known for its colonial architecture, shops, and eateries. Overnight stay in Shimla.

itinerary.title: Kufri and Adventure Park
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, embark on a delightful excursion to Kufri (approx. 1 hour drive), a small hill station renowned for its picturesque landscapes and winter sports. Kufri is often covered in snow during the winter months, offering a magical experience. Visit Kufri Fun World, an amusement park with various rides and activities. You can also explore the Himalayan Nature Park, home to various Himalayan fauna. For an adventurous experience, you have the option to take a horse ride to Mahasu Peak (on direct payment), offering stunning views. Return to Shimla by evening. Overnight stay in Shimla.

itinerary.title: Mashobra and Naldehra
itinerary.description: After breakfast, your day is dedicated to exploring the serene surroundings of Shimla. Drive to Mashobra (approx. 30 minutes drive), a beautiful hill station known for its lush greenery and tranquil atmosphere, perfect for nature walks and peaceful retreats. Afterward, head to Naldehra (approx. 30 minutes from Mashobra), famous for its challenging Naldehra Golf Course and beautiful scenic meadows. Spend some time amidst nature. Return to Shimla by afternoon, where you can enjoy some relaxed café time or a final stroll along the Mall Road. Overnight stay in Shimla.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred back to Chandigarh (approx. 4-5 hours drive) for your onward journey by train, flight, or bus. Depart with beautiful mountain memories of your 'Serene Shimla' getaway. Package starting from 15,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 3 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Shimla.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 4).
All transfers and sightseeing by private car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).
Full-day excursion to Kufri including visits to Kufri Fun World and Himalayan Nature Park (entrance fees to Kufri Fun World are additional).
Half-day excursion to Mashobra and Naldehra.
Local sightseeing in Shimla including The Ridge, Christ Church, Scandal Point, and Mall Road.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Airfare/train fare/bus fare to and from Chandigarh.

relatedPackages.title: Chai & Chill in the Hills: Dharamshala & McLeodganj

title: Chai & Chill in the Hills: Dharamshala & McLeodganj
description: Indulge in the serene tranquility of the Himalayas with our 'Chai & Chill in the Hills' package, a perfect 5-day escape to Dharamshala and McLeodganj. This journey invites you to explore the spiritual heart of the Tibetan community in exile, stroll through lush tea gardens, discover cascading waterfalls, and soak in the breathtaking views of the Dhauladhar range. Experience a unique blend of adventure, culture, and relaxation in these charming hill towns.
highlights: Immerse yourself in the tranquility of Dharamshala, visiting the War Memorial and scenic Tea Gardens.
Explore the spiritual hub of McLeodganj, home to the Dalai Lama Temple and a vibrant Tibetan culture.
Hike to the picturesque Bhagsu Waterfall and seek blessings at Bhagsunath Temple.
Discover local Tibetan markets and cozy bookstores for a unique cultural experience.
Enjoy a scenic day trip to Palampur, famous for its sprawling tea estates and lush green fields.
Visit the serene Naddi View Point and the charming Dal Lake for stunning views of the Dhauladhar mountains.
Savor local flavors and enjoy the laid-back café culture of the region.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Dharamshala – Local Exploration
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival in Dharamshala (by bus or private transfer), you will be met by our representative and transferred to your pre-booked hotel in Dharamshala. Check-in and take some time to refresh. In the afternoon, begin your local exploration with a visit to the solemn War Memorial, commemorating the brave soldiers of Himachal Pradesh. Afterwards, enjoy a leisurely stroll through the picturesque Tea Gardens of Dharamshala, soaking in the serene atmosphere. Spend the evening relaxing and exploring the charming local cafés, known for their ambiance and local delicacies. Overnight stay in Dharamshala.

itinerary.title: McLeodganj & Bhagsu
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, proceed for a full-day exploration of McLeodganj, often called 'Little Lhasa' due to its significant Tibetan population and the residence of His Holiness the Dalai Lama. Visit the revered Dalai Lama Temple Complex (Tsuglagkhang Complex), the spiritual heart of the Tibetan community in exile. Afterward, embark on a short, scenic hike to the cascading Bhagsu Waterfall and visit the ancient Bhagsunath Temple. In the evening, explore the vibrant Tibetan Market, perfect for finding unique souvenirs and handicrafts, and browse through local bookstores for insightful reads on Tibetan culture and Buddhism. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in McLeodganj.

itinerary.title: Day Trip to Palampur & Tea Estates
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic full-day trip to Palampur (approx. 1.5-2 hours drive), famously known as the 'Tea Capital of North India'. The drive itself is beautiful, offering views of sprawling tea gardens and lush green fields. Upon arrival, immerse yourself in the serene ambiance of the tea estates. En route, you can visit the tranquil Chamunda Devi Temple, a significant Hindu pilgrimage site. You also have the optional opportunity to visit the Andretta Artists Village, a charming center for pottery and arts (additional cost for entry/activities). Return to McLeodganj by evening, refreshed by the serene landscapes. Overnight stay in McLeodganj.

itinerary.title: Naddi & Dal Lake, Return to Dharamshala
itinerary.description: After breakfast, start your day with a visit to Naddi View Point, offering spectacular panoramic views of the majestic Dhauladhar mountain range. Afterward, proceed to the quaint Dal Lake (smaller than the one in Kashmir), surrounded by deodar trees, offering a peaceful setting. Spend some time enjoying café hopping in the area, savoring local flavors while soaking in the stunning views of the Dhauladhars. In the late afternoon, transfer back to Dharamshala for your final night. Enjoy a leisure evening, perhaps doing some last-minute souvenir shopping or packing for departure. Overnight stay in Dharamshala.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Gaggal Airport (DHM) for your onward flight or to the nearest bus stand for your bus journey. Depart with cherished memories of your 'Chai & Chill in the Hills' adventure. Package starting from 20,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Dharamshala.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in McLeodganj.

title: Nainital Diaries: Lakes & Hills Escape
description: Unfold the charming 'Nainital Diaries: Lakes & Hills Escape', a perfect 4-day retreat to the picturesque Kumaon region of Uttarakhand. This package is designed to offer a serene experience amidst the glistening lakes and verdant hills of Nainital, along with excursions to its equally beautiful sister lakes – Bhimtal, Sattal, and Naukuchiatal. Immerse yourself in the tranquility of nature, enjoy boat rides, and explore local culture on this refreshing getaway.
highlights: Experience the enchanting beauty of Nainital, the 'Lake Town' of India.
Enjoy leisurely strolls and shopping on the famous Mall Road.
Seek blessings at the sacred Naina Devi Temple.
Gain panoramic views of the Himalayas and Naini Lake from Snow View Point via ropeway.
Explore other scenic viewpoints like Tiffin Top and Naina Peak, and visit the Nainital Zoo.
Indulge in boating on the crescent-shaped Naini Lake.
Discover the cluster of interconnected lakes at Sattal and the unique nine-cornered Naukuchiatal.
Visit Bhimtal, known for its large lake with an island aquarium.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Nainital – Lake Town Welcome
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Kathgodam Railway Station (or a pre-arranged pick-up point), you will be met by our representative. Enjoy a scenic drive to Nainital (approx. 1.5-2 hours), nestled amidst the Kumaon Himalayas. Upon arrival, check-in at your comfortable hotel and take some time to relax. In the evening, take a leisurely stroll along the bustling Mall Road, soaking in the vibrant atmosphere and enjoying the lakeside views. Visit the revered Naina Devi Temple, located on the northern shore of Naini Lake. You can also enjoy local street food and, if time permits, a relaxing boat ride on Naini Lake. Overnight stay in Nainital.

itinerary.title: Nainital Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of Nainital. Start with a ride on the Nainital Ropeway to Snow View Point, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the snow-capped Himalayan peaks and the entire Naini Lake. Afterward, visit Tiffin Top (Dorothy's Seat), another popular viewpoint offering stunning vistas. Explore Naina Peak (also known as China Peak), the highest point in Nainital, providing extensive views of the surrounding landscape (can be reached by trek or pony ride, optional). Conclude your day with a visit to The Zoo (Pt. G.B. Pant High Altitude Zoo), home to various Himalayan species. In the evening, enjoy boating in Naini Lake and some shopping at the Tibetan Market near the Flatts. Overnight stay in Nainital.

itinerary.title: Lake Circuit – Bhimtal, Sattal, Naukuchiatal
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day excursion to the beautiful 'Lake Circuit' surrounding Nainital. Your first stop is Bhimtal (approx. 22 km), known for its much larger lake with a picturesque island aquarium in the center, where you can enjoy boating. Next, visit Sattal (approx. 23 km), a cluster of seven freshwater lakes surrounded by dense pine and oak forests, offering a serene and untouched natural beauty. Finally, proceed to Naukuchiatal (approx. 26 km), the 'lake of nine corners', famous for its tranquil environment and opportunities for optional activities like paragliding (on direct payment). Return to your hotel in Nainital by evening. Overnight stay in Nainital.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Kathgodam Railway Station for your onward journey. Depart with cherished memories of your 'Nainital Diaries: Lakes & Hills Escape'. Package starting from 15,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 3 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Nainital.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 4).
All transfers and sightseeing by private car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).

title: Rishikesh Gateway: Adventure & Spirituality
description: Unlock the 'Rishikesh Gateway: Adventure & Spirituality', a perfect 3-day short escape to the 'Yoga Capital of the World'. This compact yet comprehensive package offers an exhilarating blend of adventure activities like white-water rafting on the Ganges, spiritual immersion with Ganga Aarti and ashram visits, and leisurely exploration of Rishikesh's iconic bridges and vibrant café culture. Experience the tranquil yet energetic vibes of this sacred town nestled in the foothills of the Himalayas.
highlights: Experience the spiritual ambiance of Rishikesh from your Ganga-facing accommodation or riverside camp.
Witness the awe-inspiring Ganga Aarti ceremony at Triveni Ghat.
Explore the iconic Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula suspension bridges.
Embark on an exhilarating white-water rafting adventure on the holy Ganges.
Discover the serene beauty of Neer Garh Waterfall.
Visit Parmarth Niketan Ashram, a renowned spiritual center.
Indulge in Rishikesh's vibrant café culture, with options like The Beatles Café.
Opportunity to attend meditation or yoga sessions for a soul-soothing experience.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Rishikesh – River Vibes Begin
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Haridwar Railway Station (HW) or Dehradun Airport (DED), you will be met by our representative and transferred to Rishikesh (approx. 1-1.5 hours drive from either location). Check-in to your pre-booked Ganga-facing hotel or riverside camp, offering serene views of the holy river. After refreshing, embark on an evening exploration of Rishikesh. Walk across the famous suspension bridges, Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula, enjoying the bustling atmosphere and scenic river views. In the evening, immerse yourself in the divine ambiance of the Ganga Aarti ceremony at Triveni Ghat, a mesmerizing spiritual ritual. Overnight stay in Rishikesh.
itinerary.accommodation: Ganga-facing Hotel or Riverside Camp in Rishikesh

itinerary.title: Adventure & Spirituality
itinerary.description: Start your day with an invigorating adventure! After an early breakfast, gear up for an exhilarating white-water rafting experience on the Ganges River (choose between a 9 km or 16 km stretch, depending on your preference and thrill level). After the adrenaline rush, visit the serene Neer Garh Waterfall, a beautiful spot for relaxation and a refreshing dip. In the afternoon, explore the renowned Parmarth Niketan Ashram, known for its spiritual teachings and grand statues. Spend your evening café hopping in Tapovan, a vibrant area filled with eclectic cafes; make sure to try famous spots like 'The Beatles Café' or 'Little Buddha Cafe'. You also have the optional opportunity to attend a meditation or yoga session at one of the many ashrams for a truly soul-soothing experience. Overnight stay in Rishikesh.
itinerary.accommodation: Ganga-facing Hotel or Riverside Camp in Rishikesh

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your accommodation and check-out, you will be transferred back to Haridwar Railway Station or Dehradun Airport for your onward journey. If time permits and you wish, you can make a brief stop to visit some prominent Haridwar temples or Mansa Devi Temple before your departure. Depart with soulful and unforgettable memories of your 'Rishikesh Gateway' adventure. Package starting from 13,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable Ganga-facing hotel or riverside camp in Rishikesh.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel/camp (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 3).
All transfers from/to Haridwar Railway Station or Dehradun Airport by private car/cab.
All local sightseeing in Rishikesh by private car/cab (Lakshman Jhula, Ram Jhula, Triveni Ghat, Neer Garh Waterfall, Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Tapovan café area).
One session of White Water Rafting on Ganges (9 km or 16 km stretch with all safety gear and expert guide).
Attendance at Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Train fare/airfare to Haridwar/Dehradun.
Optional activities not mentioned in inclusions (e.g., bungee jumping, giant swing, rock climbing, other adventure sports).
Entrance fees to any temples or attractions (if any, apart from specified activities).

Travel insurance.
Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, natural calamities, etc.

title: Magical Kerala: Hills, Spices & Backwaters
description: Embark on 'Magical Kerala: Hills, Spices & Backwaters', a captivating 5-day journey that unveils the diverse beauty of 'God's Own Country'. This meticulously crafted package takes you from the bustling city of Kochi to the serene tea plantations of Munnar, the lush spice gardens and wildlife of Thekkady, culminating in an unforgettable houseboat experience through the tranquil backwaters of Alleppey. Immerse yourself in Kerala's rich culture, breathtaking landscapes, and unique experiences.
highlights: Enjoy a scenic drive through rubber plantations and captivating waterfalls en route to Munnar.
Explore the vast tea estates and lush greenery of Munnar, including Eravikulam National Park and the Tea Museum.
Discover the vibrant spice plantations of Thekkady and experience its rich biodiversity with optional wildlife safaris.
Witness mesmerizing cultural performances like Kathakali or Kalaripayattu (Martial Arts show) in Thekkady.
Indulge in an authentic overnight houseboat cruise through the tranquil backwaters of Alleppey, savoring traditional Kerala cuisine.
Experience the blend of hills, spices, and serene waters that define Kerala's unique charm.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kochi – Drive to Munnar (4.5 hrs)
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Cochin International Airport (COK) or Ernakulam Junction Railway Station (ERS), you will be warmly welcomed by our representative. Begin your picturesque journey with a scenic drive to Munnar (approx. 4.5 hours), a renowned hill station nestled amidst lush tea plantations. En route, marvel at the stunning beauty of Valara Falls and Cheeyappara Falls, cascading down rocky cliffs. As you drive, you'll pass through fragrant rubber plantations and spice gardens. Upon reaching Munnar, check-in to your comfortable hotel. Spend the evening at leisure, perhaps taking a short stroll around the property or simply relaxing amidst the cool mountain air. Overnight stay in Munnar.

itinerary.title: Munnar Sightseeing – Tea & Nature
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of Munnar. Start your day with a visit to Eravikulam National Park (Rajamalai), home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr (Park visit is subject to opening and availability, ticket queue can be long). Next, delve into the history of tea at the Tea Museum, where you can learn about the processing of tea and even sample some. Continue to the picturesque Mattupetty Dam, a popular spot for boating. Enjoy the natural acoustics at Echo Point, and admire the serene beauty of Kundala Lake. You can opt for speed boating or horse riding at Mattupetty Dam (optional, direct payment). Return to your hotel in Munnar by evening. Overnight stay in Munnar.

itinerary.title: Munnar to Thekkady (3.5 hrs) – Spice & Wildlife
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Munnar hotel, embark on a scenic drive to Thekkady (approx. 3.5 hours), famous for its Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary and spice plantations. Upon arrival, check-in to your resort. In the afternoon, visit the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, where you can opt for a boat safari on Periyar Lake (optional, direct payment, pre-booking recommended) to spot diverse wildlife. Later, embark on an informative Spice Plantation Tour, where you'll learn about various spices like cardamom, pepper, vanilla, and cinnamon. In the evening, you have the option to witness a vibrant Kathakali (traditional Kerala dance) show or a thrilling Kalaripayattu (Kerala Martial Arts) show, or even enjoy an Elephant Ride (all optional, direct payment). Overnight stay in Thekkady.

itinerary.title: Thekkady to Alleppey (4 hrs) – Houseboat Experience
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Thekkady resort, drive to Alleppey (Alappuzha) (approx. 4 hours), the hub of Kerala's famous backwaters. Upon arrival, embark on a truly unique and enchanting experience as you board your private premium houseboat. Settle in and begin cruising through the serene and picturesque backwaters, winding past lush paddy fields, quaint villages, and traditional Kerala homes. All your meals (lunch, evening tea with snacks, and dinner) featuring delicious Kerala cuisine will be served onboard by your dedicated crew. Enjoy the tranquility and beauty of the backwater life from the comfort of your houseboat. Overnight stay in the Houseboat in Alleppey.

itinerary.title: Departure from Kochi
itinerary.description: Enjoy a delicious breakfast onboard your houseboat as you slowly cruise back towards the docking point. After breakfast, you will disembark at Alleppey and be transferred to Cochin International Airport (COK) or Ernakulam Junction Railway Station (ERS) for your onward journey. Depart with unforgettable memories of your 'Magical Kerala: Hills, Spices & Backwaters' tour. Package starting from 30,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel/resort in Munnar.
1 Night accommodation in a comfortable hotel/resort in Thekkady.
1 Night accommodation in a private premium houseboat in Alleppey.
Daily breakfast at hotels/resorts (Day 2, 3, 4, 5).
Dinner at hotels/resorts in Munnar & Thekkady (Day 1, 2, 3).
All meals (lunch, evening tea, dinner, breakfast) on the houseboat (Day 4 & 5).
All transfers and sightseeing by private air-conditioned car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).
En-route stops at Valara & Cheeyappara Falls.
Munnar sightseeing including Eravikulam National Park (transport only), Tea Museum, Mattupetty Dam, Echo Point, Kundala Lake.
Thekkady sightseeing including Spice Plantation Tour.
Houseboat cruise in Alleppey with all amenities.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Airfare/train fare to and from Kochi.
Entrance fees to Eravikulam National Park, Tea Museum, Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, or any other monuments/attractions.
Optional activities such as boating in Mattupetty Dam, speed boating/horse riding, Periyar Lake boat safari, Kathakali/Martial Arts show, Elephant Ride.
Lunch in Munnar and Thekkady.
Personal expenses such as laundry, telephone calls, tips for drivers/guides/houseboat crew, etc.
Travel insurance.
Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, natural calamities, etc.

title: Magical Mussoorie: Queen of Hills Retreat
description: Discover the 'Magical Mussoorie: Queen of Hills Retreat', a enchanting 4-day escape to one of India's most beloved hill stations. This package is designed to offer a blend of colonial charm, breathtaking natural beauty, and exciting activities. From strolling along the bustling Mall Road to enjoying the cascading Kempty Falls and exploring the serene landscapes of Dhanaulti, this trip promises a rejuvenating and memorable experience amidst the Himalayas.
highlights: Experience a comfortable drive from Dehradun to the picturesque 'Queen of Hills', Mussoorie.
Enjoy leisurely walks and vibrant atmosphere on Mussoorie's famous Mall Road.
Ascend to Gun Hill via ropeway for panoramic views of the Himalayas and Doon Valley.
Cool off and relax at the iconic Kempty Falls.
Explore the beautiful Company Garden with its manicured lawns and artificial waterfall.
Take a scenic sunset stroll on Camel’s Back Road.
Discover the tranquil beauty of Dhanaulti and its Eco Park.
Seek blessings at the hilltop Surkanda Devi Temple, offering splendid views.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Mussoorie – Queen of Hills Welcome
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Dehradun Railway Station (DDN) or Jolly Grant Airport (DED), you will be met by our representative. Enjoy a picturesque drive to Mussoorie (approx. 1.5-2 hours), often referred to as the 'Queen of Hills'. Upon arrival, check-in at your comfortable hotel and take some time to relax and refresh. In the evening, take a leisurely walk along the bustling Mall Road, soaking in the colonial charm and vibrant atmosphere. You can also take a ropeway ride to Gun Hill (optional, direct payment), offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Himalayan range and the Doon Valley. Overnight stay in Mussoorie.

itinerary.title: Mussoorie Local Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of Mussoorie. Your first stop will be the famous Kempty Falls, a popular cascade where you can enjoy a refreshing dip or simply relax by the waters (entry fees and specific activities like bathing suits rental are on direct payment). Afterward, visit the beautiful Company Garden (Municipal Garden), known for its well-maintained lawns, flowerbeds, and a mini artificial waterfall. In the evening, take a leisurely and scenic walk along Camel’s Back Road, famous for its rock formation resembling a camel’s hump and offering stunning sunset views. You have the optional choice to visit Mussoorie Library for its historical significance or trek/drive to George Everest Peak for more panoramic views (trekking/local transport charges may apply). Overnight stay in Mussoorie.

itinerary.title: Day Trip to Dhanaulti & Eco Park
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a refreshing day trip to the scenic town of Dhanaulti (approx. 28 km from Mussoorie). Dhanaulti is known for its peaceful environment and dense deodar forests, offering a serene escape. Visit the popular Eco Park, a sprawling park divided into 'Amber' and 'Dhara' sections, perfect for nature walks and enjoying the crisp mountain air. You can also trek up to the sacred Surkanda Devi Temple (requires a short trek or pony ride), offering splendid 360-degree views of the Himalayas. For the adventurous, there are optional activities like ziplining and skywalk at adventure parks in Dhanaulti (on direct payment). Return to Mussoorie by evening. Overnight stay in Mussoorie.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred back to Dehradun Railway Station or Jolly Grant Airport for your onward journey. Depart with magical memories of your 'Mussoorie: Queen of Hills Retreat'. Package starting from 18,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 3 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Mussoorie.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 4).
All transfers from/to Dehradun Railway Station or Dehradun Airport by private car/cab.
All local sightseeing in Mussoorie by private car/cab (Kempty Falls, Company Garden, Camel’s Back Road).
Full-day excursion to Dhanaulti including visits to Eco Park and Surkanda Devi Temple (transport only).
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Train fare/airfare to and from Dehradun.
Optional activities like ropeway to Gun Hill, horse riding/trekking/local transport to George Everest Peak, ziplining/skywalk in Dhanaulti.
Entrance fees to Kempty Falls, Company Garden, Eco Park, or any other monuments/attractions not specifically mentioned.
Lunch throughout the trip.
Personal expenses such as laundry, telephone calls, tips for drivers/guides, etc.
Travel insurance.
Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, landslides, natural calamities, etc.

relatedPackages.title: Chai & Chill in the Hills: Dharamshala & McLeodganj

title: Mystic Kerala Bliss: Beaches, Cliffs & Backwaters
description: Embark on 'Mystic Kerala Bliss', a mesmerizing 6-day journey that takes you through the captivating coastal beauty and tranquil backwaters of Southern Kerala. This package offers a perfect blend of sun-kissed beaches, dramatic cliffside views, cultural city excursions, and serene backwater experiences. From the iconic beaches of Kovalam to the unique Varkala cliffs and the peaceful lagoons of Alleppey, immerse yourself in the enchanting charm of 'God's Own Country'.
highlights: Relax and unwind on the famous beaches of Kovalam including Lighthouse Beach, Hawa Beach, and Samudra Beach.
Explore the cultural and historical gems of Trivandrum city, including the iconic Padmanabhaswamy Temple.
Experience the unique cliffside beauty of Varkala, known for its stunning views, Papanasam Beach, and Janardanaswamy Temple.
Enjoy breathtaking sunsets from the cliffside cafes in Varkala.
Immerse yourself in the serene backwater charm of Alleppey with opportunities for Shikara rides.
Discover local life by walking through lush paddy fields and indulging in optional Ayurvedic spa treatments.

itinerary.title: Arrival at Trivandrum – Transfer to Kovalam
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Trivandrum International Airport (TRV) or Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station (TVC), you will be warmly greeted by our representative. Enjoy a short scenic drive (approx. 30 minutes) to Kovalam, one of Kerala's most famous beach destinations. Check-in to your comfortable beach resort and take some time to relax. In the afternoon, head out to explore Kovalam's beautiful crescent-shaped beaches: Lighthouse Beach with its iconic lighthouse, the lively Hawa Beach (Eve's Beach), and the more secluded Samudra Beach. Enjoy the relaxed beach vibe and explore the beachside cafes. Overnight stay in Kovalam.

itinerary.title: Day trip to Trivandrum City
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day excursion to Trivandrum City (Thiruvananthapuram), the capital of Kerala (approx. 30 minutes drive each way). Begin with a visit to the magnificent Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, renowned for its intricate architecture and spiritual significance (dress code applies, non-Hindus may have restricted access to inner sanctum). Explore the fascinating Napier Museum and the adjacent Kuthiramalika Palace Museum (Puthen Malika Palace), showcasing traditional Kerala architecture and royal artifacts. Conclude your city tour with a visit to Shanghumugham Beach, known for its unique mermaid statue and peaceful atmosphere. Return to Kovalam by evening. Overnight stay in Kovalam.

itinerary.title: Kovalam to Varkala (2 hrs) – Cliffside Escape
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Kovalam resort, enjoy a scenic drive to Varkala (approx. 2 hours), a unique beach destination famous for its stunning laterite cliffs rising dramatically from the Arabian Sea. Upon arrival, check-in to your comfortable beachside resort. Spend the afternoon exploring the vibrant Varkala Cliff Walk, lined with shops, cafes, and guesthouses offering panoramic ocean views. Descend to Papanasam Beach, believed to have holy waters that cleanse sins. Also, visit the ancient Janardanaswamy Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. In the evening, witness a spectacular sunset from the cliffside cafés, enjoying the serene ambiance. Overnight stay in Varkala.

itinerary.title: Varkala to Alleppey (3.5 hrs) – Backwater Serenity
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out from your Varkala resort, transfer to Alleppey (Alappuzha) (approx. 3.5 hours), the heart of Kerala's enchanting backwaters. Upon arrival, check-in at a charming backwater resort located by the serene lagoons (note: this package does not include an overnight houseboat stay, but a resort experience). Spend the afternoon relaxing by the tranquil lagoon or by the poolside. In the evening, you have the optional opportunity to experience the serene beauty of the backwaters on a traditional Shikara ride (on direct payment), gliding through narrow canals and witnessing local village life. Overnight stay in Alleppey.

itinerary.title: Alleppey – Leisure & Local Life
itinerary.description: Enjoy a leisurely breakfast at your backwater resort. This day is dedicated to experiencing the charm of Alleppey at your own pace. You can take a peaceful walk through the lush green paddy fields and interact with the friendly locals, gaining insight into their daily lives. For ultimate relaxation, consider indulging in a traditional Ayurvedic spa or massage session (optional, direct payment) offered by many resorts in the area. In the afternoon, you can explore Alleppey town, visit the local market, or spend time relaxing at Alleppey Beach. Overnight stay in Alleppey.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your resort and check-out, you will be transferred to your departure point. Depending on your flight/train schedule, you can be transferred to Cochin International Airport (COK), Ernakulam Junction Railway Station (ERS), or Trivandrum International Airport (TRV) / Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station (TVC) for your return journey. Depart with 'Mystic Kerala Bliss' memories. Package starting from 35,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable beach resort in Kovalam.
1 Night accommodation in a comfortable beachside resort in Varkala.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable backwater resort in Alleppey.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the resorts (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 6).
All transfers and sightseeing by private air-conditioned car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).
Transfers from/to Trivandrum Airport/Railway Station.
Full-day excursion to Trivandrum City (Padmanabhaswamy Temple - exterior view, Napier Museum, Kuthiramalika Palace, Shanghumugham Beach).
Varkala sightseeing (Varkala Cliff, Papanasam Beach, Janardanaswamy Temple).
Alleppey backwater resort stay with leisure time.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Airfare/train fare to and from Trivandrum/Cochin.
Entrance fees to Padmanabhaswamy Temple (if applicable for non-Hindus, and any special darshan tickets), Napier Museum, Kuthiramalika Palace, or any other monuments/attractions.
Optional activities such as Shikara rides in Alleppey, Ayurvedic spa/massage treatments, water sports at beaches.

Any costs incurred due to unforeseen circumstances like road closures, natural calamities, etc.

title: Royal Rajasthan: A Cultural Extravaganza
description: Immerse yourself in the grandeur of India with our 'Royal Rajasthan: A Cultural Extravaganza' package. This 7-day journey takes you through the most iconic cities of Rajasthan – Jaipur, Jodhpur, and Udaipur – each offering a unique glimpse into the opulent history, vibrant culture, and architectural marvels of the Rajput era. From magnificent forts and palaces to bustling bazaars and serene lakes, experience the royal charm and warm hospitality of Rajasthan.
highlights: Explore the magnificent forts and palaces of Jaipur, the 'Pink City', including Amber Fort and City Palace.
Witness the architectural brilliance of Jantar Mantar and the iconic Hawa Mahal.
Experience the vibrant culture of Rajasthan with an optional traditional dinner at Chokhi Dhani.
Discover the 'Blue City' of Jodhpur, with its imposing Mehrangarh Fort and charming blue houses.
Visit the serene Ranakpur Jain Temples, a marvel of marble architecture.
Indulge in the romantic allure of Udaipur, the 'City of Lakes', with boat rides on Lake Pichola.
Explore Udaipur's majestic City Palace, Jagdish Temple, and the beautiful Saheliyon Ki Bari.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Jaipur – Pink City Welcome
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Jaipur Airport (JAI) or Jaipur Railway Station (JP), you will be warmly greeted by our representative. Transfer to your pre-booked hotel and complete the check-in formalities. After a brief rest, embark on a half-day city tour of Jaipur. Visit the majestic City Palace, a splendid blend of Rajput and Mughal architecture. Explore Jantar Mantar, an astronomical observatory and UNESCO World Heritage Site. Marvel at the iconic Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), known for its intricate facade. In the evening, you have the optional opportunity to visit Chokhi Dhani, an ethnic village resort, for a traditional Rajasthani dinner, cultural performances, and folk activities (on direct payment). Overnight stay in Jaipur.

itinerary.title: Jaipur Forts & Local Vibes
itinerary.description: After breakfast, prepare for a day of historical exploration. Visit the grandeur of Amber Fort, a magnificent fort-palace located on a hill. Enjoy an elephant ride (subject to availability and local regulations) or a jeep ride up to the fort entrance. En route, make a stop for a photo opportunity at Jal Mahal, the beautiful 'Water Palace' seemingly floating in Man Sagar Lake. In the afternoon, explore the impressive Albert Hall Museum, Rajasthan's oldest museum, and then delve into the bustling local markets of Jaipur, famous for textiles, jewelry, and handicrafts. Overnight stay in Jaipur.

itinerary.title: Jaipur to Jodhpur (Approx. 6 hrs drive)
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out, begin your overland journey to Jodhpur (approx. 6 hours drive), the 'Blue City' of Rajasthan. En route, you have the option to visit the revered Ajmer Dargah Sharif, a Sufi shrine, or the holy town of Pushkar, famous for its sacred lake and the only Brahma Temple in the world (choose one based on your preference and time availability). Upon arrival in Jodhpur, check-in to your hotel. In the evening, take a stroll through the vibrant Clock Tower Market, known for its spices, textiles, and local handicrafts. Overnight stay in Jodhpur.

itinerary.title: Jodhpur Sightseeing – The Blue City
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of Jodhpur. Start with the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, one of India's largest and most impressive forts, perched high above the city. Explore its palaces, courtyards, and museum, offering breathtaking views of the 'Blue City'. Visit Jaswant Thada, a beautiful marble cenotaph built in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II. Also, see the grand Umaid Bhawan Palace, a part of which is still a royal residence and a heritage hotel. For the adventurous, there's an optional ziplining experience at Mehrangarh Fort (on direct payment). Conclude your day with a walk through the charming Blue Houses of Navchowkiya, experiencing the unique indigo-hued lanes. Overnight stay in Jodhpur.

itinerary.title: Drive to Udaipur via Ranakpur Jain Temple (5 hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast and check-out, commence your journey to Udaipur (approx. 5 hours drive), the romantic 'City of Lakes'. En route, make a significant stop to visit the exquisitely carved Ranakpur Jain Temples, a magnificent complex of marble temples known for their intricate architecture and 1,444 uniquely carved pillars. After soaking in the spiritual and architectural marvel, continue your drive to Udaipur. Upon arrival, check-in to your hotel. In the evening, enjoy a serene boat ride on Lake Pichola (optional, direct payment), admiring the illuminated City Palace and Jag Mandir. Overnight stay in Udaipur.

itinerary.title: Udaipur – City of Lakes
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of Udaipur. Visit the grand City Palace, a complex of palaces, courtyards, and gardens, offering stunning views of Lake Pichola. Explore the exquisite Jagdish Temple, a large Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Discover the beautiful Saheliyon Ki Bari (Garden of Maidens), known for its fountains and kiosks. In the afternoon, visit Fateh Sagar Lake and enjoy its scenic surroundings. Explore Bagore Ki Haveli Museum, a historic haveli showcasing Mewar culture and artifacts. Conclude your day with a mesmerizing sunset view from the Karni Mata Temple Ropeway (optional, direct payment), offering panoramic views of the city. Overnight stay in Udaipur.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Udaipur Airport (UDR) or Udaipur City Railway Station (UDZ) for your onward journey. Depart with unforgettable memories of your 'Royal Rajasthan: A Cultural Extravaganza'. Package starting from 30,000 INR per person.

inclusions: 2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Jaipur.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Jodhpur.
2 Nights accommodation in a comfortable hotel in Udaipur.
Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotels (starting with dinner on Day 1, ending with breakfast on Day 7).
All transfers and sightseeing by private air-conditioned car/cab (as per itinerary, for up to 4 PAX).
Jaipur sightseeing (City Palace, Jantar Mantar, Hawa Mahal, Amber Fort, Jal Mahal, Albert Hall Museum, local markets).
Jodhpur sightseeing (Mehrangarh Fort, Jaswant Thada, Umaid Bhawan Palace, Blue Houses of Navchowkiya, Clock Tower Market).
Udaipur sightseeing (City Palace, Jagdish Temple, Saheliyon Ki Bari, Fateh Sagar Lake, Bagore Ki Haveli Museum).
En route stop at Ranakpur Jain Temples.
All applicable taxes and service charges.
exclusions: Airfare/train fare to Jaipur and from Udaipur.
Optional activities such as Chokhi Dhani visit, elephant/jeep ride at Amber Fort (unless specified as included), ziplining at Mehrangarh Fort, boat ride on Lake Pichola, Karni Mata Temple Ropeway.
Entrance fees to monuments, palaces, forts, museums, or any other attractions unless specifically mentioned.
Lunch throughout the trip.

Travel insurance.

title: Goa Gateway: Beaches, Culture & Fun
description: Embark on the 'Goa Gateway: Beaches, Culture & Fun' package, a perfect 4-day escape to India's most vibrant coastal destination. This itinerary offers a fantastic blend of sun-kissed beaches, thrilling water sports, rich Portuguese history, and bustling markets. From the lively shores of North Goa to the serene charm of Old Goa and Panjim, get ready to experience the unique 'Susegad' lifestyle and create unforgettable memories.
highlights: Experience the lively beaches of North Goa, including Calangute, Baga, Anjuna, and Vagator.
Explore historic landmarks like Fort Aguada, offering panoramic ocean views.
Indulge in thrilling water sports such as jet skiing, banana boat rides, and parasailing (optional).
Discover the rich colonial heritage of Old Goa with visits to magnificent churches like the Basilica of Bom Jesus and Se Cathedral.
Stroll through the charming Latin Quarter of Fontainhas in Panjim, renowned for its colorful architecture.
Enjoy shopping for local handicrafts, spices, and souvenirs at Panjim or Mapusa Market.
Optional sunset cruise on the Mandovi River, offering picturesque views and entertainment.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Goa – Chill Begins
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Goa International Airport (GOX/GOI) or Madgaon/Vasco Railway Station, you will be warmly greeted by our representative. Enjoy a comfortable transfer to your pre-booked hotel in North Goa (typically in the lively Calangute/Baga area). After check-in and refreshing, the rest of the day is at your leisure. You can immediately head to the nearest beach to soak up the sun, enjoy the waves, or explore the myriad of beach shacks and cafes for some delicious Goan cuisine and refreshing drinks. In the evening, immerse yourself in the vibrant nightlife that North Goa is famous for. Overnight stay in North Goa.

itinerary.title: North Goa Sightseeing & Beach Fun
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of North Goa. Your exploration begins with the historic Fort Aguada, a 17th-century Portuguese fort offering panoramic views of the Arabian Sea. Continue to the popular beaches of North Goa, including Sinquerim Beach (near Fort Aguada), the vibrant Anjuna Beach (famous for its flea market on Wednesdays), and the picturesque Vagator Beach, known for its dramatic red cliffs. Spend ample time at Baga and Calangute Beaches, the most popular and bustling beaches, where you can indulge in various optional water sports like jet skiing, banana boat rides, or parasailing (on direct payment). Enjoy the lively atmosphere and beachfront shacks. Overnight stay in North Goa.

itinerary.title: Portuguese Trail & Panjim Exploration
itinerary.description: After breakfast, delve into Goa's rich Portuguese heritage. Drive to Old Goa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and visit its iconic churches: the magnificent Basilica of Bom Jesus, housing the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier, and the grand Se Cathedral, one of Asia's largest churches. Afterward, explore Panjim, the charming capital city. Take a leisurely walk through the colorful Latin Quarter of Fontainhas, known for its narrow streets and vibrant colonial houses. You can enjoy some shopping at Panjim Market for local spices, Feni, and cashew nuts, or explore the more traditional Mapusa Market (active on Fridays). In the evening, you have the optional opportunity to enjoy a delightful Sunset Cruise on the Mandovi River (on direct payment), with live music and Goan folk dances. Overnight stay in North Goa.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your hotel and check-out, you will be transferred to Goa International Airport (GOX/GOI) or Madgaon/Vasco Railway Station for your onward journey. Depart with sun-kissed memories of your 'Goa Gateway: Beaches, Culture & Fun' escape. Package starting from 15,000 INR per person.

title: Goa Beyond Beaches: Culture, Spice & Serenity
description: Uncover the hidden gems of Goa with our 'Goa Beyond Beaches: Culture, Spice & Serenity' package. This 5-day immersive journey takes you beyond the popular sandy shores to explore the rich cultural heritage, lush spice plantations, and tranquil side of this vibrant state. From the serene beaches of South Goa to the historic marvels of Old Goa and the aromatic world of spice farms, experience a different facet of Goa that promises an enriching and relaxing getaway.
highlights: Experience the serene and less-crowded beaches of South Goa, including Palolem, Colva, and Benaulim.
Explore the iconic viewpoints of Miramar and Dona Paula.
Discover Goa's spiritual side with visits to traditional Hindu temples like Shantadurga and Mangeshi.
Immerse yourself in the fragrant world of a traditional Goan Spice Plantation, including a traditional lunch.
Delve into Goa's rich Portuguese history by exploring the churches and monuments of Old Goa, including the Basilica of Bom Jesus and Se Cathedral.
Enjoy a day trip to the bustling beaches and vibrant atmosphere of North Goa, with opportunities for water sports.
Witness stunning sunsets at picturesque locations like Palolem or Butterfly Beach.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Goa – Transfer to South Goa
itinerary.description: Upon your arrival at Goa International Airport (GOX/GOI) or Madgaon/Vasco Railway Station, you will be warmly greeted by our representative. Enjoy a comfortable transfer to your pre-booked resort in South Goa (typically in the tranquil Palolem, Colva, or Benaulim area). After check-in, the day is at your leisure. You can unwind by the serene beach, indulge in a relaxing spa session at your resort (optional, direct payment), or simply enjoy the peaceful ambiance of South Goa. Overnight stay in South Goa.

itinerary.title: South Goa Exploration: Beaches & Temples
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day sightseeing tour of South Goa. Begin by exploring the pristine beaches such as Colva Beach and Benaulim Beach, known for their golden sands and peaceful atmosphere. Continue to Miramar Beach, a popular urban beach, and the scenic Dona Paula Viewpoint, offering panoramic views where the Mandovi and Zuari rivers meet the Arabian Sea. In the afternoon, discover Goa's rich cultural heritage with visits to traditional Hindu temples like the elegant Shantadurga Temple and the beautiful Mangeshi Temple, both showcasing distinct Goan architecture. Conclude your day by witnessing a breathtaking sunset at Palolem Beach or Butterfly Beach (depending on accessibility and time). Overnight stay in South Goa.

itinerary.title: Spice Plantation & Old Goa Heritage
itinerary.description: After breakfast, prepare for an enriching cultural and culinary experience. Head to a traditional Spice Plantation (located in Ponda area), where you'll be taken on a guided tour to learn about the various spices grown in Goa. Enjoy a delicious traditional Goan lunch served at the plantation. Afterward, delve into Goa's rich Portuguese past with a visit to Old Goa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore its magnificent churches, including the iconic Basilica of Bom Jesus, housing the relics of St. Francis Xavier, and the grand Se Cathedral, one of Asia's largest churches. Drive back to your resort in South Goa for a leisure evening. Overnight stay in South Goa.

itinerary.title: North Goa Day Trip: Bustle & Beaches
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day excursion to North Goa (approx. 1.5-2 hours drive one way), known for its lively beaches and vibrant atmosphere. Explore the popular beaches of Anjuna, Vagator, Baga, and Calangute, each offering a unique vibe. Visit the historic Chapora Fort, offering stunning views of Vagator Beach and the Arabian Sea. Spend time relaxing at the beach shacks or indulging in optional water sports like jet skiing, banana boat rides, or parasailing (on direct payment). Experience the contrast between the tranquil south and the bustling north. Return to your resort in South Goa by evening. Overnight stay in South Goa.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast at your resort and check-out, you will be transferred to Goa International Airport (GOX/GOI) or Madgaon/Vasco Railway Station for your onward journey. Depart with a deeper appreciation for Goa's diverse offerings, 'beyond beaches'. Package starting from 20,000 INR per person.
